Activity: Arrive at the office, grab coffee. Check news and emails. Maybe watch a quick sports highlight.
Review Legal Counsel's response (if received). Adjust research focus based on their input. If no response, send a reminder email.

Focus on establishing a preliminary framework for tracking fund expenses. Identify categories of expenses (management fees, performance fees, legal fees, audit fees, etc.). Determine how each expense will be allocated and tracked.

Contact @coo-1 (Chief Operating Officer) via email. Subject: Fund Expense Tracking Framework - Input Needed. Ask for their input on the proposed expense categories and allocation methods. Request any historical data or relevant policies.
Continue developing the fund expense tracking framework. Research best practices for expense allocation in similar funds. Document assumptions and methodologies clearly.
Lunch break. Play some foosball in the break room with colleagues.
Review the combined performance and expense tracking framework. Ensure the two frameworks are integrated and consistent.

Start exploring software options for tracking fund performance and expenses. Research commercially available fund accounting software and potentially explore building a custom solution (if necessary).
Document the preliminary tracking framework. Prepare a brief presentation outlining the key components, data sources, and reporting requirements.
Wrap up for the day. Respond to any outstanding emails. Plan for tomorrow's tasks.
